        <article class="post-20 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-20">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Home
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-1 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-bottom is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">

              </a>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <form action="https://www.master-promise.eu/" class="wp-block-search__button-outside wp-block-search__text-button wp-block-search" method="get" role="search">
             <label class="wp-block-search__label" for="wp-block-search__input-1">

             <div class="wp-block-search__inside-wrapper">
              <input class="wp-block-search__input" id="wp-block-search__input-1" name="s" placeholder="" required="" type="search" value=""/>
              <button aria-label="Search" class="wp-block-search__button wp-element-button" type="submit">

          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-2 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow" style="flex-basis:100%">
            <h1 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center">
             The driver for the EMJM PROMISE
            </h1>
            <p class="has-text-align-center">
             The Erasmus Mundus Joint Master in Sustainable Mineral and Metal Processing Engineering-EMJM PROMISE is being established due to the awareness of increasing demands in the quantity and diversity of minerals, metals, and materials as we move towards renewable energy, electromobility, digital communication and other clean-energy technologies.
            </p>
            <p class="has-text-align-center">
             PROMISE is the consortium involving the cooperation between four leading universities in mineral processing and mining engineering:
             <strong>
              University of Oulu from Finland (UOULU), University of Zagreb from Croatia (UNIZG), Montanuniversität Leoben from Austria (MUL) and Universidad Federico Santa Maria from Chile (USM).
             </strong>
            </p>
            <div class="wp-block-image">
             <figure class="aligncenter size-large is-resized">
              <img alt="" class="wp-image-190" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="768" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-1024x768.jpg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-1024x768.jpg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-300x225.jpg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-768x576.jpg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-1536x1152.jpg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-2048x1536.jpg 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-360x270.jpg 360w" style="width:845px;height:auto" width="1024"/>
             </figure>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h1 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center">
           <a data-id="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" data-type="URL" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
            Programmes and modules
           </a>
          </h1>
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-3 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <figure class="wp-block-image size-large is-style-default">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-8" decoding="async" height="682" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/PIC8888-1024x682.jpg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/PIC8888-1024x682.jpg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/PIC8888-300x200.jpg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/PIC8888-768x511.jpg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/PIC8888-1536x1022.jpg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/PIC8888-360x240.jpg 360w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/PIC8888.jpg 1920w" title="" width="1024"/>
             <figcaption class="wp-element-caption">
              <strong>
               <a data-id="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" data-type="URL" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
                Mineral Processing Value Chain
               </a>
              </strong>
             </figcaption>
            </figure>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-239" decoding="async" height="683" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/MUL_IMAGE_150-1024x683.jpg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/MUL_IMAGE_150-1024x683.jpg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/MUL_IMAGE_150-300x200.jpg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/MUL_IMAGE_150-768x512.jpg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/MUL_IMAGE_150-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/MUL_IMAGE_150-2048x1365.jpg 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/MUL_IMAGE_150-360x240.jpg 360w" width="1024"/>
             <figcaption class="wp-element-caption">
              <strong>
               <a data-id="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" data-type="URL" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
                Industrial Mineral Processing and Bulk Solids Technology
               </a>
              </strong>
             </figcaption>
            </figure>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-4 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-236" decoding="async" height="768" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Depos_01-1024x768.jpg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Depos_01-1024x768.jpg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Depos_01-300x225.jpg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Depos_01-768x576.jpg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Depos_01-1536x1152.jpg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Depos_01-2048x1536.jpg 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/Depos_01-360x270.jpg 360w" width="1024"/>
             <figcaption class="wp-element-caption">
              <strong>
               <a data-id="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" data-type="URL" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
                Circular Economy and Recycling
               </a>
              </strong>
             </figcaption>
            </figure>
           </div>

        <article class="post-20 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-20">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">

          </h1>
         </header>

         <div class="entry-content">

           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow" style="flex-basis:100%">
            <h1 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center">
             The driver for the EMJM PROMISE
            </h1>
            <p class="has-text-align-center">
             The Erasmus Mundus Joint Master in Sustainable Mineral and Metal Processing Engineering-EMJM PROMISE is being established due to the awareness of increasing demands in the quantity and diversity of minerals, metals, and materials as we move towards renewable energy, electromobility, digital communication and other clean-energy technologies.
            </p>
            <p class="has-text-align-center">
             PROMISE is the consortium involving the cooperation between four leading universities in mineral processing and mining engineering:
             <strong>
              University of Oulu from Finland (UOULU), University of Zagreb from Croatia (UNIZG), Montanuniversität Leoben from Austria (MUL) and Universidad Federico Santa Maria from Chile (USM).
             </strong>
            </p>
            <div class="wp-block-image">
             <figure class="aligncenter size-large is-resized">
              <img alt="" class="wp-image-190" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="768" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-1024x768.jpg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-1024x768.jpg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-300x225.jpg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-768x576.jpg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-1536x1152.jpg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-2048x1536.jpg 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/20190829_084223-360x270.jpg 360w" style="width:845px;height:auto" width="1024"/>
             </figure>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h1 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center">
           <a data-id="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" data-type="URL" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/programme-modules/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
            Programmes and modules
           </a>
          </h1>
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-3 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">

             <img alt="" class="wp-image-238" decoding="async" height="768" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/flotation-expertsystems-1024x768.jpg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/flotation-expertsystems-1024x768.jpg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/flotation-expertsystems-300x225.jpg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/flotation-expertsystems-768x576.jpg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/flotation-expertsystems-1536x1152.jpg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/flotation-expertsystems-2048x1536.jpg 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/flotation-expertsystems-360x270.jpg 360w" width="1024"/>

           “

            The European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), in the context of managing the Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters, collects and processes the personal data of some of the candidates. In particular, certain data of the scholarship holders and non-scholarship holders is shared with the Agency and treated according to

           </a>
           <em>
            “
           </em>
          </p>
          <h1 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center">
           Recent News
          </h1>
          <div class="wp-block-query is-layout-flow wp-block-query-is-layout-flow">
           <ul class="columns-3 wp-block-post-template is-layout-grid wp-container-core-post-template-is-layout-1 wp-block-post-template-is-layout-grid">
            <li class="wp-block-post post-1396 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news">
             <h2 class="wp-block-post-title">
              <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/4th-intake-evaluation-of-applications-complete/" target="_self">
               4th intake: Evaluation of applications complete
              </a>
             </h2>
             <div class="wp-block-post-excerpt">
              <p class="wp-block-post-excerpt__excerpt">
               All formally compliant applications to our 4th intake have now been evaluated. The consortium is finalizing its selections. Notifications to all applicants will go out shortly via email. Stay tuned!
              </p>
             </div>
             <div class="wp-block-post-date">
              <time datetime="2025-03-17T09:10:20+02:00">
               March 17, 2025
              </time>
             </div>
            </li>
            <li class="wp-block-post post-1400 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news">
             <h2 class="wp-block-post-title">
              <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/update-evaluation-for-the-4th-intake/" target="_self">
               Update: Evaluation for the 4th intake
              </a>
             </h2>
             <div class="wp-block-post-excerpt">
              <p class="wp-block-post-excerpt__excerpt">
               Of the roughly 800 sent applications, about 270 made it into the assessment stage. Evaluation is still going on. The selection by the PROMISE board and the respective notifications are now expected for 15 March (was: beginning of March). Stay Read More …
              </p>
             </div>
             <div class="wp-block-post-date">
              <time datetime="2025-03-04T09:05:36+02:00">
               March 4, 2025
              </time>
             </div>
            </li>
            <li class="wp-block-post post-1389 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general category-news">
             <h2 class="wp-block-post-title">
              <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/leoben-the-next-destination-for-our-erasmus-promise-program/" target="_self">
               Leoben: The Next Destination for Our Erasmus PROMISE Program
              </a>
             </h2>
             <div class="wp-block-post-excerpt">
              <p class="wp-block-post-excerpt__excerpt">

        <article class="post-462 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry" id="post-462">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">

          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <img alt="" class="aligncenter wp-post-image" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="246" sizes="(max-width: 847px) 100vw, 847px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/chalcopyrite_Featured4-1024x297.png" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/chalcopyrite_Featured4-1024x297.png 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/chalcopyrite_Featured4-300x87.png 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/chalcopyrite_Featured4-768x222.png 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/chalcopyrite_Featured4-1536x445.png 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/chalcopyrite_Featured4-360x104.png 360w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/chalcopyrite_Featured4.png 1688w" width="847"/>
          <h1 class="wp-block-heading">
           EMJM-PROMISE is particularly suited for (but not limited to) graduates in mineral processing, metallurgical and chemical engineering, chemists, raw materials scientists and engineers, mining engineers, materials scientists, or related engineering fields.

         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           About Us
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           The Erasmus Mundus Joint Master in Sustainable Mineral and Metal Processing Engineering-PROMISE is being established due to the awareness of increasing demands in the quantity and diversity of minerals, metals, and materials as we move towards renewable energy, electromobility, digital communication and other clean-energy technologies.
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">

           </a>
          </h2>
          <p>
          </p>
         </div>

         </footer>

       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-45 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-45">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Admission Requirements
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           EMJM PROMISE is particularly suited for graduates in mineral processing, metallurgical engineering, chemical engineering, materials and mineral resources engineering, earth resources engineering, raw materials and process engineering, mining and mineral engineering, mining engineering, geological engineering, related process engineering, raw materials engineers, materials and rock waste treatment engineering, or related engineering fields, with a minimum BSc degree at the moment of application.
          </p>
          <h4 class="wp-block-heading">
           Required documents
          </h4>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Certified original copy of university bachelor’s degree diploma (translated to English);
           </li>
           <li>
            Certified copy of Transcript of Records (translated to English) and originals (subject courses correspondent to the degree, along with the marks obtained and the number of hours/credits devoted to each subject);
           </li>
           <li>
            Proof of nationality (copy of passport or ID-card);
           </li>
           <li>
            Motivation letter, max 1 page, convincing why applicant could be selected;
           </li>
           <li>
            Recommendation letters (one compulsory and one optional) uploaded in the application;
           </li>
           <li>
            A scanned certificate of English proficiency (those fulfilling the below requirements are only accepted);
           </li>
           <li>
            Curriculum vitae in EuroPass format (see link
            <a href="https://europa.eu/europass/en" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             https://europa.eu/europass/en
            </a>
            ) with your photo on the first page.
           </li>
           <li>
            Optional: certificate for training in entrepreneurship
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           All documents need to be in English. Translations (diploma and transcript) need to be either certified (by your university) or legalised. Only the selected applicants must bring the original documents to be presented to the university during the first week of the study period.
           <br/>
           We do not review documents sent by e-mail, so please ensure to apply via the online application portal.
          </p>
          <p>
           Applications submitted after the deadline or applications submitted outside the PROMISE official submission tool will not be considered.
          </p>
          <h4 class="wp-block-heading">
           Requirement on Transcript of Records
          </h4>
          <p>
           Whilst other courses relevant to mineral processing are beneficial in assessing your application, compulsory subjects are
           <strong>
            mathematics
           </strong>
           and either of chemistry or physics. If this is not included in your transcript, then your application will not be considered in the evaluation procedure.
          </p>
          <h4 class="wp-block-heading">
           English language requirements
          </h4>
          <p>
           Any of the entries in the following list qualifies for a valid application.
           <br/>
           <strong>
            Note:
           </strong>
           The list is exhaustive, no other certificates will be accepted.
           <br/>
           <strong>
            Note:
           </strong>
           Even if your language of education was English throughout, you must provide either one of the certificates listed below or a degree covered by the “Degrees in English” bullet in this list.
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            TOEFL iBT or iBT Special Home Edition: total score of 92 points (with a minimum of 20 in Listening, Reading, Speaking and Writing). Valid for two years.
           </li>
           <li>
            TOEFL pBT (minimum total score 570). Valid for two years.
           </li>
           <li>
            IELTS Academic or Indicator: overall band score of at least 6.5 (minimum 5.5 in each section). Valid for two years.
           </li>
           <li>
            PTE Academic: minimum score 62 (at least 52 in the Writing section). Valid for two years.
           </li>
           <li>
            C1 Advanced (former Cambridge English: Advanced, CAE) Pass Level A, B, C. No expiry date.
           </li>
           <li>
            C2 Proficiency (former Cambridge English: Proficiency, CPE) Pass Level A, B, C or C1. No expiry date.
           </li>
           <li>
            Degrees in English: the degree must have been completed in a university of any of the following countries: EU/EEA, Australia, Canada, Great Britain, New Zealand, or the United States. Online degrees and offshore campuses do not qualify.
           </li>
           <li>
            20 ECTS credits of studies conducted in English language at a Finnish higher education institution.
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Note:
           </strong>
           We have an extended deadline for the English Certificate only: 31 January 2025.
           <br/>
           As the deadline for the application proper remains unchanged, you need to upload a document stating your exam date and expected date for getting the result as a substitute. If you provide your result within the extension (as PDF via e-mail to
           <a href="mailto: info@master-promise.eu">
            <info@master-promise.eu>
           </a>
           , it will be added to your application file.
          </p>
          <p>
           Some of the certificates listed above offer online versions with a more rapid delivery of your result. Consider this, when time is short.
          </p>
          <h4 class="wp-block-heading">
           Any questions?
          </h4>
          <p>
           If you are in doubt, please
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/faq/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
            read the FAQ
           </a>
           before sending a message. Most probably you will find your answer there already!
          </p>
          <div class="wp-block-buttons is-layout-flex wp-block-buttons-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-button">
            <a class="wp-block-button__link wp-element-button" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/apply-online/">
             How to apply online?
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

        <article class="post-458 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry" id="post-458">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Application window for self-funded students with the 4th intake now open!
          </h1>
         </header>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-47 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-47">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Apply Online
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Candidates from all over the world are invited to apply. After having carefully read all requirements and FAQs, the application can be done by filling out and submitting all the necessary documents in the online application of the EMJM PROMISE website.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Online application
          </h2>
          <p>
           The application window for being part of the fourth intake with an EM scholarship was from October 1
           <sup>
            st
           </sup>
           to December 31
           <sup>
            st
           </sup>
           , 2024. Currently, there is an application window for self-funded students exclusively until March 15
           <sup>
            th
           </sup>
           , 2025.
          </p>
          <p>
           You must fill in the online application forms and upload all required scanned attachments (in coulour and in PDF format) by the application deadline. Please note that you do not need to complete the whole application form at once. You can save it any time and finish it later during the period of application.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Erasmus Mundus scholarship
          </h2>
          <p>
           All valid applications from the general call will be considered for a scholarship. Taking part as a self-funded student will be offered to a number of applicants with high ranking if they do not receive a scholarship.
           <strong>
            Note:
           </strong>
           having secured additional funds beforehand is absolutely compatible with getting an Erasmus scholarship, as long as these funds are not coming directly from the EU! To get started, please read the Scholarships & Fees section.
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <div class="wp-block-buttons is-layout-flex wp-block-buttons-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-button">
            <a class="wp-block-button__link wp-element-button" href="https://application.master-promise.eu/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             Go to the application platform. Submit your application as self-funded student until 15 Mar 2025!
            </a>
           </div>
          </div>
          <p>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Associated Partners
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           We have the collaboration and support of 41 Associated Partners (33 from the beginning) including 22 mining companies, 4 recycling companies, 4 research centres, 6 mining suppliers and 3 universities.

          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           <strong>
            Looking to recruit a PROMISE program intern with meaningful responsibilities and the possibility to make an impact?
           </strong>
          </h2>
          <p>
           In the fouth-semester (Jan-July), students should develop a Master Thesis, the research work is based on on-site or lab investigation (usually three months). After the data collection period, students develop the thesis flowing the scientific reach method and supervised and co-supervised by the university and associate partner. Master thesis subjects may be proposed by the industrial partner or professors.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           <strong>
            Can associate partners can propose a project topic?
           </strong>
          </h2>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Yes, APs can make an impact in supporting a brighter future for our students
           </li>
           <li>
            Promise Consortium will send you a list of project options
           </li>
           <li>
            You can submit your own topic by emailing info@master-promise.eu and this will be discussed with a suitable supervisor of the partners’ universities
           </li>
          </ul>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           <strong>
            Can students propose a topic?
           </strong>
          </h2>
          <p>
           Yes, if a company different from the associate partners is able to support your project (internship, access to data, plant, etc.), and your research works with samples and analysis ask a supervisor to register your topic in the nearest PROMISE university.
          </p>

      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-243 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-243">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Consortium Partners
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           The Erasmus Mundus Joint Master in Sustainable Mineral and Metal Processing Engineering-PROMISE is being established due to the awareness of increasing demands in the quantity and diversity of minerals, metals, and materials as we move towards renewable energy, electromobility, digital communication and other clean-energy technologies.
          </p>
          <p>
           The consortium organising PROMISE consists of four Universities: The University of Oulu – Finland, The Montauniversität Leoben – Austria, The University of Zagreb – Croatia and Universidad Tecnica Federico Santa Maria – Chile.
          </p>
          <p>
           These partners complement and strengthen each other by involving top-level mineral processing laboratories, pilot plants, analytical equipment and recognized scholars and experts. In addition, the consortium has strong ties with the processing industry. A cluster of 31 mining companies, research centres, suppliers and universities demonstrated their endorsement of this program (as associate partners); this provides an excellent environment for the success of this master programme.
          </p>
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-1 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <h4 class="wp-block-heading">
             <a data-id="https://www.oulu.fi/en/university/faculties-and-units/faculty-technology/oulu-mining-school" data-type="URL" href="https://www.oulu.fi/en/university/faculties-and-units/faculty-technology/oulu-mining-school" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              University of Oulu – Finland
             </a>
            </h4>
            <figure class="wp-block-image">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-39" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="577" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/UOulu_campus2-1024x577.jpg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/UOulu_campus2-1024x577.jpg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/UOulu_campus2-300x169.jpg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/UOulu_campus2-768x433.jpg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/UOulu_campus2-1536x866.jpg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/UOulu_campus2-360x203.jpg 360w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/UOulu_campus2.jpg 1920w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <h4 class="wp-block-heading">
             <a data-id="https://www.unileoben.ac.at/" data-type="URL" href="https://www.unileoben.ac.at/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              Montauniversität Leoben – Austria
             </a>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-79 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-79">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Learning Environment
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-1 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <p>
             <strong>
              The University of Oulu (UOULU)
             </strong>
             is currently the only national Finnish institution located in Europe offering a degree in mineral processing at the Oulu Mining School, at the graduate and postgraduate level:
            </p>
            <p class="has-text-align-center">
             <a href="https://www.oulu.fi/en" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              University of Oulu
             </a>
            </p>
            <p class="has-text-align-center">
             <a href="https://www.oulu.fi/en/university/faculties-and-units/faculty-technology/oulu-mining-school" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              Oulu Mining School
             </a>
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <figure class="wp-block-image size-full">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-444" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="768" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Oulu_LEn_1024.png" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Oulu_LEn_1024.png 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Oulu_LEn_1024-300x225.png 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Oulu_LEn_1024-768x576.png 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Oulu_LEn_1024-360x270.png 360w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-2 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <figure class="wp-block-image size-full">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-445" decoding="async" height="683" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/MUL_LEnv_1024.png" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/MUL_LEnv_1024.png 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/MUL_LEnv_1024-300x200.png 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/MUL_LEnv_1024-768x512.png 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/MUL_LEnv_1024-360x240.png 360w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <p>
             <strong>
              Montanuniversität Leoben (MUL)
             </strong>
             has been established in 1840 for the education of mining and metallurgy engineers. Since then, the range of studies has been extended and covers the entire life cycle of primary raw materials from geology to recycling.
            </p>
            <p>
             <a href="https://www.unileoben.ac.at/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              Montanuniversität Leoben
             </a>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-3 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <p>
             <strong>
              The University of Zagreb (UNIZG)
             </strong>
             is the largest (34 constituent units) and the oldest (since 1669) university in Croatia. The Faculty of Mining, Geology and Petroleum Engineering at the University of Zagreb is the only Croatian national institution that offers study programs of Mining Engineering and Mineral Processing.
            </p>
            <p class="has-text-align-center">
             <a href="http://www.unizg.hr/homepage/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              University of Zagreb
             </a>
            </p>
            <p class="has-text-align-center">
             <a href="https://www.rgn.unizg.hr/en/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              The Faculty of Mining, Geology and Petroleum Engineering
             </a>
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <figure class="wp-block-image size-full">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-446" decoding="async" height="768" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/ZG_LEnv_1024.png" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/ZG_LEnv_1024.png 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/ZG_LEnv_1024-300x225.png 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/ZG_LEnv_1024-768x576.png 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/ZG_LEnv_1024-360x270.png 360w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-4 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <figure class="wp-block-image size-full">
             <img alt="" class="wp-image-447" decoding="async" height="768" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/USM-LE_1024.png" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/USM-LE_1024.png 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/USM-LE_1024-300x225.png 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/USM-LE_1024-768x576.png 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/USM-LE_1024-360x270.png 360w" width="1024"/>
            </figure>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <p>
             <strong>
              Universidad Técnica Federico Santa María
             </strong>
             <strong>
              (USM)
             </strong>
             is a recognized institution for Science and Engineering in Chile, founded in 1926. USM is the largest engineering school in Chile, it has 4 campuses, the main campus is located in Valparaiso.
            </p>
            <p class="has-text-align-center">
             <a href="https://usm.cl/en/home/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
              Universidad Técnica Federico Santa María
             </a>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

        <article class="post-85 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-85">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           PROMISE story
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           The cooperation between partners started in 2016 and we carry out many workshops in 2019 to give life to PROMISE.
          </p>
          <figure class="wp-block-gallery has-nested-images columns-default is-cropped wp-block-gallery-1 is-layout-flex wp-block-gallery-is-layout-flex">
           <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
            <img alt="" class="wp-image-450" data-id="450" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="768" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/meeting-Croatia.png" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/meeting-Croatia.png 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/meeting-Croatia-300x225.png 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/meeting-Croatia-768x576.png 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/meeting-Croatia-360x270.png 360w" width="1024"/>
           </figure>
           <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
            <img alt="" class="wp-image-453" data-id="453" decoding="async" height="768" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/20191219_101109-1024x768.jpg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/20191219_101109-1024x768.jpg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/20191219_101109-300x225.jpg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/20191219_101109-768x576.jpg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/20191219_101109-1536x1152.jpg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/20191219_101109-2048x1536.jpg 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/20191219_101109-360x270.jpg 360w" width="1024"/>
           </figure>
          </figure>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Project summary
          </h2>
          <p>
           The EMJM PROMISE aims to train world-class mineral processing postgraduates and future leaders to take the sector into a sustainable future. PROMISE is a two-year and 120 ECTS Master’s Programme. The language of instruction in PROMISE is English and provides an incentive to learn the partners’ national languages which will provide a broad multidisciplinary education in the sustainable recovery of valuable minerals and metals.
          </p>
          <p>
           The consortium organising PROMISE consists of four universities – the University of Oulu-Finland, the Montanuniversität Leoben-Austria, the University of Zagreb-Croatia and the Universidad Tecnica Federico Santa Maria-Chile. These partners complement and strengthen each other by involving top-level mineral processing laboratories, pilot plants, analytical equipment and recognized scholars and experts. In addition, the consortium has strong ties with the processing industry and a cluster of 31 mining companies, research centres, suppliers and universities demonstrated their endorsement to this program (as associate partners); this provides an excellent environment for the success of this master programme.
          </p>
          <p>
           Students will have broad competence with specialisation in the main areas of mineral beneficiation emphasised in better mineral recovery from primary and secondary sources, metal recycling (urban mining) and by-product recovery meeting the demands of today’s industry and environmental protection as an integral part of the circular economy. Students will move to at least three HEIs. Upon completion, students will be awarded multiple master’s degree diplomas and a Diploma Supplement.
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-12 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-12">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Programme
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Objectives
          </h2>
          <p>
           The aim of EMJM-PROMISE is to train world-class mineral processing postgraduates and future leaders to take the sector into a sustainable future.
          </p>
          <p>
           Mineral processing represents one of the most interesting subject areas, combining engineering, chemistry and applied mathematics. Graduated mineral processors will use their specialised knowledge of the chemical and physical properties of metals and minerals to extract them from their natural ores and anthropogenic sources (by-products, wastes, low-grade materials) and maximise production whilst minimising the overall environmental impact through sustainable practices. Additionally, great savings of resources (such as water and energy) and time can be achieved if skilled mineral processing professionals apply their mathematical modelling and simulation knowledge in plant design and optimization of unit operations (comminution, mineralogy, flotation, solid-liquid separation, circular use of process water).
          </p>
          <h3 class="wp-block-heading">
           Specific objectives
          </h3>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Improve the education for future mineral processing engineers and the productivity of current and future processing plants whilst sustaining earth’s carrying capacity through the adoption of genuine use of innovative and sustainable techniques in the recovery of valuable minerals.
           </li>
           <li>
            Ensure that competent professionals have the skill set to strive for a resource-efficient management and use of raw materials, to support innovation and use of best available technologies to provide materials for clean mobility and fulfil environmental standards. Therefore, the Joint Master program is aligned with the European Union priority strategy ‘A European Green Deal’.
           </li>
           <li>
            Develop new synergies and cooperative efforts among relevant stakeholders in the areas of sustainable mineral processing development, complex mineralogy, low-grade ores, metallic and non-metallic minerals, and urban mining.
           </li>
           <li>
            Gain and apply technical knowledge and scientific information to develop new processes aiming for significant energy and water savings and to use best available technologies (BAT) for optimisation of mineral processes.
           </li>
           <li>
            Improve intercultural understanding by attracting the best students and getting better information and communication through the mobility of people, ideas, and technology.
           </li>
           <li>
            Integrate more sustainability in engineering education, resulting in a lower CO
            <sub>
             2
            </sub>
            footprint, higher recovery rates and less waste, lower energy and water demand.
           </li>
          </ul>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-92 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-92">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Programme modules
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           MODULE 1:
           <a>
            Modern mineral processing value chain
           </a>
          </h2>
          <p>
           This module covers a wide area of the recovery of minerals, the whole chain from mineralogy to raw material for smelters. Students will learn major aspects of mineral processing such as mineral characterization, geometallurgy, mineral separation process, modelling and simulation, automation and quality of marketable concentrates.
          </p>
          <p>
           The fundamentals are presented with a critical and applied look, considering technical and economic aspects that are complemented with practical experiences in specific laboratories for each unit operation and in an automatized pilot plant, also visit industrial plants will be considered. Modelling and simulation using software programs for mineral processing give the possibility to integrate mineralogical/modal data to plant optimization. For mineral characterisation, OMS has applied knowledge in this field, and has laboratories of optical microscopy, geochemical, geotechnical and MAKE the Centre for Material Analysis to apply different characterization techniques to identify surface mineral properties, mineral liberation, microstructure, nature, and textures by means of the latest available equipment such as FESEM, EPMA, XRD and XRF.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           MODULE 2: Industrial Minerals Processing and Bulk Solids Technology
          </h2>
          <p>
           The second module focuses on industrial minerals and building materials. These comprise minerals that do not serve as sources of metals although they may contain these elements but are used for the properties of these minerals. Some prominent examples are calcite, magnesite and talc. The lecture is complemented by a hands-on course in the well-equipped laboratory that deals with selected topics from this range of minerals.
          </p>
          <p>
           This module also contains several supplementary topics, such as sampling and homogenisation as a means for proper planning of test campaigns and providing a consistent feed to the plant, respectively. Another core element within the processing plant taught here is bulk solids technology. Obligatory lectures also deal with sustainability with raw materials and with mineral economics.
          </p>
          <p>
           An important subject in this module is the project study, where the students actively work on a concrete challenge within mineral processing. This requires literature study, application of prior knowledge in the subject, own lab work and composition of a proper and concise report.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           MODULE 3A: Sustainable Mineral Processing Plant Design and Engineering
          </h2>
          <p>
           Advanced and Sustainable Mineral Concentration. This module will cover innovative approaches to mineral and metal processing. In terms of particle size reduction (i.e., comminution), energy curves will be addressed, so those energy requirements will be specifically determined for the different stages of comminution. In terms of valuable particle separation, concepts such as incremental and step-change innovation will also be addressed. Fine particle flotation separation and trace valuable separation must be dealt with since ore mineralogy is more complex and much harder to process. Consequently, courses such as process mineralogy, physical separation, and flotation innovations are mandatory to include in postgraduate degree training. Environmental aspects must also be considered since mineral and metal process engineering has very large water and energy footprints. In practical terms, postgraduate courses to be taught are energy-efficient comminution, water-efficient mineral processing, sustainable mineral processing plant design, digitalization and smart system in mineral processing, and sustainable mineral processing engineering.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           MODULE 3B: Circular Economy and Recycling
          </h2>
          <p>
           This module covers the transition from the traditional linear (take-make-dispose) to the new concept of a sustainable circular economy (take-recycle). Students will learn about sustainable mineral/waste resource management through maximising yield and utilising secondary raw materials by reuse, recycling and reprocessing minerals/waste.
          </p>
          <p>
           The knowledge acquired through the first two modules will be upgraded by management and application of technological processes and procedures in the circular economy, solid waste recycling, tailings management and reprocessing, soil remediation, naturally occurring radioactive materials (NORM) residues processing and disposal. Theoretically acquired knowledge will be supplemented by laboratory exercises (Mineral Processing and Environmental Protection Laboratory, Geomechanical Laboratory, Laboratory for the analysis of geological materials – LaGEMA) and by visiting industrial plants.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           MODULE 4: Thesis
          </h2>
          <p>
           30 ECTS MSc thesis supervised by one partner university and executed at cooperating companies.
          </p>
          <p>
           The 4th semester of the programme is intended to be mostly ‘hands on’, enabling the trainees to have closer contact with the practical aspects of sustainable mineral processing issues and collaborating with associate partners (industry, research centres or suppliers) for the final Master Thesis development. The collaboration and support of 33 Associated Partners including 26 mining companies, 2 research centres, 2 mining suppliers and 3 universities ensure the practical work for thesis development.
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-94 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-94">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Curriculum
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Students will acquire specialization and competence in the main areas of mineral beneficiation with an emphasis on better mineral recovery from primary and secondary sources, metal recycling (urban mining), by-product recovery meeting the demands of today’s industry and environmental protection as an integral part of the circular economy. Students will move to at least three HEIs. Upon completion, students will be awarded multiple master’s degree Diplomas and a Diploma Supplement.
          </p>
          <p>
           Concerning mobility during the two-year master’s programme, students will study together in three different universities:
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            30 ECTS at University of Oulu in Finland (UOULU) – Oulu Mining School
           </li>
           <li>
            30 ECTS at Montanuniversität Leoben, Austria (MUL)
           </li>
           <li>
            30 ECTS at either Universidad Tecnica Federico Santa Maria, Chile (USM) or University of Zagreb, Croatia (UNIZG)
           </li>
           <li>
            30 ECTS MSc thesis (co-supervised by all partner universities) and in cooperation with industry
           </li>
          </ul>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Obligatory courses
          </h2>
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-538" decoding="async" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Curriculum_Obligatory-752x1024.png"/>
          </figure>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Elective courses
          </h2>
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-large is-resized">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-740" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="644" sizes="(max-width: 746px) 100vw, 746px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Curriculum_Elective-1024x884.png" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Curriculum_Elective-1024x884.png 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Curriculum_Elective-300x259.png 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Curriculum_Elective-768x663.png 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Curriculum_Elective-1536x1326.png 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Curriculum_Elective-2048x1769.png 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Curriculum_Elective-313x270.png 313w" width="746"/>
          </figure>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Master thesis
          </h2>
          <p>
           In Semester 4, students will develop a thesis with a focus on industry application.
          </p>
          <p>
           One of the academic benefits for students is internships and industry thesis. A pool of Thesis topics shall be proposed by Industry-Associate partners (at the end of the first semester), and the HEI coordinator and the student must agree on the topic. Once the Associate Partner agrees on receiving the student, the student, the programme/partner country located (where the organisation is established), and the company, must all sign an Agreement for the Internship that describes the rights and responsibilities of all the parties involved, the duration of the internship, the name of the student´s supervisor within the organisation, among other aspects. The student´s internship supervisor will evaluate the student once the internship is finalised and a report is present it could be credited by the HEIS. Internships will last between 2 to 3 months (ideally 3), a period in which the student must develop their experimental plan, execute and gather data for their thesis projects
          </p>
          <p>
           The dissertation of the master thesis (including discussions with supervisors during the master thesis writing period) is inherent in the programme of study.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           EMJM PROMISE diploma
          </h2>
          <p>
           The student, if successful in the respective examinations achieving the learning outcomes of the program and thesis dissertation, will receive multiple degrees from the hosting Universities where the student has mobility, and a Diploma Supplement parchment Erasmus Mundus Joint Master ‘PROMISE – Sustainable Mineral and Metal Processing Engineering from all four above mentioned universities.
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

        <article class="post-98 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-98">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Mobility
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           EMJM PROMISE includes compulsory physical mobility for all enrolled students (EMJM scholarship-holders or not).
          </p>
          <p>
           Students spend at least two study periods in two countries which are different from the country of residence of the student at enrolment (‘mobility periods’) and of which at least one country is an Erasmus+ Programme Country. EMJM PROMISE students will study the first semester in Finland, the second semester in Austria, the third semester they can choose a specialisation in Croatia or Chile and in the fourth-semester students will develop the thesis in any of the partner countries.
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-505" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="574" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Mobility-1024x574.png" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Mobility-1024x574.png 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Mobility-300x168.png 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Mobility-768x431.png 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Mobility-1536x862.png 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Mobility-2048x1149.png 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/Mobility-360x202.png 360w" width="1024"/>
          </figure>
          <p>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-335 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-335">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Learning Outcomes
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Students will obtain the following specific competences:
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Understand the different separation processes and fundaments for an effective separation of metallic and industrial mineral and apply this knowledge in practical separation trials for selected ores.
           </li>
           <li>
            Analyse the layout and process design for metallic and non-metallic mineral processing operations, including the key differences between the two and the reasons for these differences.
           </li>
           <li>
            Ability to integrate methods of mineral separation and multidisciplinary requirements into a coherent solution to separate valuable minerals from less valuable gangue material evaluating surface mineral properties, and applying chemical, physical, mathematical and geometallurgical based approaches.
           </li>
           <li>
            Perform simulations of mineral processing circuits and apply the model for production, trouble shooting, plant design and optimisation.
           </li>
           <li>
            Capability to evaluate, produce and apply technical knowledge and scientific information to develop new processes aiming to energy and water saving and apply the BAT for optimisation of mineral processes.
           </li>
           <li>
            Apply beneficiation processes for recycling, reuse and reduce the production of waste material in general and particularly materials related to WEEE and NORM residues.
           </li>
           <li>
            Perform risk analysis and protection measures (personal, in the work, in operation, for the environment).
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           Students will obtain generic competencies, such as:
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Understand the purpose of mineral processing and their importance to the world economy and sustainable use of raw materials (critical thinking).
           </li>
           <li>
            Ability to work in multidisciplinary teams and solve technical and operational problems (problem solving skills).
           </li>
           <li>
            Multicultural integration.
           </li>
           <li>
            Communication and entrepreneurial skills and others proposed in the T-shape education program.
           </li>
          </ul>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-103 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-103">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Visiting Scholars
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           The  Erasmus Mundus Joint Master in Sustainable Mineral and Metal Processing Engineering can provide short-term scholarships for academic scholars and guest lecturers who can contribute to the joint programme.
          </p>
          <p>
           The selected invited academic scholars/guest lecturers are invited to carry out research or teaching assignments as part of the Master PROMISE.
           <strong>
            The preferred duration of the stay is 4-7 consecutive days (one week).
           </strong>
           However, also shorter or longer periods would be eligible. Days of scholarly work may also include travelling time.
          </p>
          <p>
           An Erasmus Mundus scholar grant will be offered to suitable candidates. The amount of the grant will be decided case by case based on the agreed activities and on travel costs to/from the hosting location.
          </p>
          <p>
           Invited scholars/guest lecturers should demonstrate outstanding academic and/or professional experience and bring concrete added value to the programme and its students.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Scholars/guest lecturers can come from any Institution including those belonging to Consortium universities or Associated partners of the Consortium
           </strong>
           .
          </p>
          <h3 class="wp-block-heading">
           Applications
          </h3>
          <p>
           10 March was the deadline for the open call for a Postdoctoral researcher to support EMJM-PROMISE, now 5 of 18 applicants have been selected for an interview.
          </p>
          <p>
           The newly recruited will be based at the University of Oulu.
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">

      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-1374 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1374">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           EIT Rawmaterial Label
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-full">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-1383" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="166" sizes="(max-width: 789px) 100vw, 789px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Labelled-by-Supported-by-1.png" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Labelled-by-Supported-by-1.png 789w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Labelled-by-Supported-by-1-300x63.png 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Labelled-by-Supported-by-1-768x162.png 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Labelled-by-Supported-by-1-360x76.png 360w" width="789"/>
          </figure>
          <p>
           The
           <strong>
            PROMISE
           </strong>
           program has been awarded the prestigious
           <strong>
            EIT Label
           </strong>
           , a mark of excellence given to top Master’s and PhD programs that transform students into innovators and game changers. EIT Label students gain deep technical expertise and critical innovation and entrepreneurship skills to develop solutions for pressing societal challenges.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            EIT RawMaterials
           </strong>
           , initiated and funded by the
           <strong>
            European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT)
           </strong>
           —a body of the
           <strong>
            European Union
           </strong>
           —is the world’s largest consortium in the raw materials sector. Its vision is to make raw materials a key strength for Europe by fostering
           <strong>
            sustainable competitiveness
           </strong>
           across the minerals, metals, and materials value chain through
           <strong>
            innovation, education, and entrepreneurship
           </strong>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <span style="box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">
            Bringing together
            <strong>
             120+ core and associate partners
            </strong>
            and over
            <strong>
             180 project partners
            </strong>
            from industry, academia, and research institutions across
            <strong>
             20+ EU countries
            </strong>
            , EIT RawMaterials spans the entire raw materials lifecycle—from
            <strong>
             exploration, mining, and mineral processing to subst
            </strong>
           </span>
           <strong>
            itution recycling and the circular economy.
           </strong>
           Through collaboration, its partners develop cutting-edge solutions to strengthen Europe’s raw materials sector and secure its supply chains.
          </p>
          <p>
           As an
           <strong>
            EIT Label student
           </strong>
           , you’ll gain exclusive access to this dynamic network, connecting with like-minded peers and professionals. You’ll also participate in
           <strong>
            exciting activities
           </strong>
           to accelerate your career in the raw materials sector.
          </p>
          <div class="wp-block-image">
           <figure class="aligncenter size-full">
            <img alt="" class="wp-image-1384" decoding="async" height="68" sizes="(max-width: 494px) 100vw, 494px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/EIT-EU.jpg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/EIT-EU.jpg 494w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/EIT-EU-300x41.jpg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/EIT-EU-360x50.jpg 360w" width="494"/>
           </figure>
          </div>
          <p>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

        <article class="post-18 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-18">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           How to Apply
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Candidates from all over the world are invited to apply. The application can be done by filling out and submitting all the necessary documents in the online application of the EMJM Promise website.
          </p>
          <p>
           Your online application in the general call will be automatically considered for the scholarship (ranking based), there is no separate application required
           <strong>
            . Only applicants with complete requirements
           </strong>
           are considered in the selection process.
          </p>
          <p>
           Every year from 2022 to 2025, 21 students will be accepted and granted a scholarship and 5 positions will be available for self-paying students.
          </p>
          <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Application for the fourth cohort – Important Dates
          </h2>
          <p>
           The application for
           <strong>
            Erasmus Mundus scholarships
           </strong>
           is open from 1 October to 31 December 2024.
           <br/>
           <br/>
           Extended deadline for the English Proficiency Certificate: 31 January 2025
           <br/>
           (see section ‘Admission Requirements’ for details)
           <br/>
           <br/>
           Due to the large number of applications, evaluation will take longer than anticipated. The ranking is expected to be availabe by 15 March 2025.
           <br/>
           Acceptance of places until 30 March 2025.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Self-funded students:
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           A dedicated application campaign will be available for self-funded students from 29 Jan to 15 Mar 2025.
           <br/>
           Acceptance of places until 30 March, 2025.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            For the actual students of the fourth intake:
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           The first-semester registration starts in August and courses at University of Oulu begin on 1 September 2025.
          </p>
          <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
          <div class="wp-block-buttons is-layout-flex wp-block-buttons-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-button">
            <a class="wp-block-button__link wp-element-button" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/admission-requirements/">
             Check out the admission requirements
            </a>
           </div>

           </a>
          </h2>

          </div>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-43 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-43">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Selection procedure
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Applications are reviewed by a selection committee. The committee rates every single eligible application on the basis of having excellent academic background including the following criteria: academic grades, degree, level of English, motivation letter, professional experience (CV), and letters of recommendation. The committee will issue a ranked list of selected candidates based on strength and maximum score.
          </p>
          <p>
           Candidates who fail to meet the minimum admission requirements are declared ineligible and their applications are not further reviewed by the selection committee.
          </p>
          <p>
           Students who have previously obtained an EMJM scholarship are not eligible to apply for an additional scholarship under EMJM PROMISE. But they can apply as self-funded students and search for other means of support.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            When offered a place in PROMISE, the selected students need to confirm their taking part. To get the study rights at University of Oulu, they must apply via
            <a data-id="https://opintopolku.fi/konfo/en/" data-type="URL" href="https://opintopolku.fi/konfo/en/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             studyinfo.fi
            </a>
            and accept the study place. The Letter of Acceptance issued by University of Oulu is required for obtaining the visa.
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           EMJM scholarships are offered to students from all over the world. However, the PROMISE consortium must ensure geographical balance – i.e. no more than 10% of the total number of scholarships awarded during project implementation should be awarded to candidates from the same nationality (this rule does not apply to top up scholarships for targeted regions of the world, if applicable).
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Appeal procedure
          </h2>
          <p>
           All applicants have the right to appeal against the selection decision. This has to be done within a period of 15 days starting from the day after the notification of the outcome of the selection. Appeals, including supporting information, may be sent via e-mail to the selection committee at
           <a href="mailto:info@master-promise.eu">
            info@master-promise.eu
           </a>
           . Please mention
           <em>
            Appeal
           </em>
           in the header of your e-mail. The selection committee will respond to the appeal within one month after the reception of the appeal.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Selection Results
          </h2>
          <p>
           The rankings will be published when all selected applicants have confirmed their participation. This is expected to be in the second half of March.
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>
