   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-337 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-337">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           FAQ
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           <strong>
            Language requirements
           </strong>
          </h2>
          <p>
           <strong>
            <em>
             Can I ask for waiving the English requirement?
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           No, The requirements are to be fulfilled, the admission offices are strict and fulfilment of all requirements is the first stage to continue your evaluation.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            <em>
             For the English proficiency requirement, is it sufficient that I have completed my bachelor’s in English?
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Only if you have graduated in the eligible countries listed in the application requirements.
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            <strong>
             The general language of education in my country is English. Is that sufficient?
            </strong>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           No. You still need to provide one of the listed certificates.
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            <strong>
             What is the time of validity of the English certificate that could be considered in the admission?
            </strong>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           Most of the International English tests have a validity of two years. Exceptionally, English test validity within 2 years and 6 months will be considered (only for those certificates mentioned in the requirements).
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            <strong>
             I have a different certificate to prove my English proficiency. Could I apply?
            </strong>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           No. Please read carefully the Admission Requirements. Evaluation is made by the Admission Committee and students must have the requirements of language published in that section.
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            <strong>
             I don’t have the English language certificates required. Could I apply?
            </strong>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           No. You need to present one from the list. If time is short, check the accepted certificates for online versions, as they might provide your test result considerably faster. Consider also applying for the next academic year.
          </p>
          <p>
           Please note that we must always be able to verify the test result from the test organisation’s database.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           <strong>
            Degrees and references
           </strong>
          </h2>
          <p>
           <strong>
            <em>
             What information should I give in the References?
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           You must provide contact details of a maximum of two academic people and please specify in what capacity the referee has interacted with you, e.g., working/teaching/tutoring/training, and for how long. Please advise them that we may contact them, so make sure they are aware of and/or agree to be contacted.
          </p>
          <p>
           Your references can be the same people/person who provide you with a Recommendation letter(s).
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            <em>
             I have both bachelor’s and master’s degrees (engineering), can I upload both?
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           A bachelor’s degree is a must, the master’s is up to you. If you want to, you can merge both degrees’ certificates in one pdf file, the same rule is applied to transcripts.
          </p>
          <p>
           You still must fill out all sections using your bachelor’s degree information (name of the university, name of degree, /final result).
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            <em>
             Can I send my application by email/post?
            </em>
           </strong>
           <em>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           No. All applications must be submitted through our online Application Portal. Applications submitted via any other means will not be processed.
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            <em>
             I will graduate soon but for the moment I don’t have the bachelor’s degree certificate yet. What do I upload for the University Diploma?
            </em>
           </strong>
           <em>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           No, you must be graduated and upload your diploma at the time of the application. However, you can be accepted if you will graduate before June but you will not be considered for scholarship.
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            <em>
             How can I apply for a visa?
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           After you are accepted into the program you will receive an information package with regards to Visa applications and others.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            <em>
             I have a different degree than mineral processing or extractive metallurgy. Could I apply?
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Students should have previous knowledge of mineral processing and extractive metallurgy. Students with related university degrees can apply with minimum BSc, but if a student is accepted need to put extra effort to be successful.
           <br/>
           Please note that having taken mathematics in your BSc is compulsory!
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            <strong>
             Must the document be certified or legalized? What is the difference?
            </strong>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           Certification of original documents means original documents issued by the university authorities in English, bearing signatures and stamps of the university.
          </p>
          <p>
           Legalized documents are necessary only if they are not issued in English by the university. In that case these documents must be legalised by an official public authority in your country or by a Public Notary.
          </p>
          <p>
           In both cases, a scan of the document needs to be uploaded. If accepted as a PROMISE student, you must bring the original documents and present them at the University of Oulu for completing your registration for the first semester.
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            <strong>
             Can I upload an academic or work letter of recommendation?
            </strong>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           Yes, any of those letters are valid, one is enough and it must be uploaded in the online application.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Restriction
          </h2>
          <p>
           <strong>
            <em>
             What are the restrictions if I am an Erasmus scholarship holder?
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           You cannot apply for an Erasmus Mundus scholarship if you have one already. However, you can apply as a self-funded student.
          </p>
          <p>
           Both with a scholarship and as self-funded, you may receive any other (additional) financial support as long as it is not funded by the Erasmus Programme or EU (e.g., government scholarships, internship salary).
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           For accepted students
          </h2>
          <p>
           <em>
            <strong>
             Could I get funding or a loan before starting my studies and a Finnish ID and bank account?
            </strong>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           No, the scholarship is for living expenses and it is paid only when students get a Finnish ID and bank account, so get those immediately after your arrival. Scholarships are paid at the end of the month.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            I accepted to be a self-funding student and/or applied as self-funded. Could I get a fund or scholarship from PROMISE universities?
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Read on the website the section Scholarships & Fees/Program Fees Self-funded students. You should make a responsible assessment of your financial situation before applying or accepting a student place and also is your responsibility to look for alternative sources of support, such as foundation grants, employer support, or state scholarships.
          </p>
          <p>
           Please, info us before 05 May if you are not participating.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Do I have to apply for Finnish and Chile visas at the same time?
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           No, you must apply for 2 years student resident permit (In Finland migration), if your path is Chile you will be given instructions in the 2nd semester to apply for a Chile student visa.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Could I go with my family and what they can do there?
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           The universities as host institutions are responsible for the topics related to the student and academic aspects. You are responsible to find suitable information if your are traveling with family.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Could I get an insurance certificate as soon as possible?
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           We have a programmed time to give those, please read the email sent to you
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-16 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-16">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Scholarships & Fees
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           EMJM PROMISE offers very attractive scholarship opportunities to allow all students with an outstanding academic background to join our programme. Applications to the PROMISE program and for Erasmus Mundus scholarships are completed simultaneously in a single online application.
          </p>
          <p>
           This year there are two types of scholarships:
          </p>
          <ol class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Full scholarships (tuition fees + 1400 €/month) are awarded to the best students in the ranking and a full-time enrolment in the master course and covers the entire duration of the master’s (24 months).
           </li>
           <li>
            Tuition fee scholarship for selected students that are next in the ranking (only tuition fees are covered 13000€/No-EU or 6500€/EU), there is no allowance and students must meet the financing requirements for residence permit application, including:
           </li>
          </ol>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            You must have 6,720 euros in your bank account when you submit the application.
           </li>
           <li>
            You must have 560 euros per month at your disposal.
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           All students receive comprehensive insurance (with the Eramus+ requirements) from the PROMISE consortium.
          </p>
          <p>
           Required literature, accommodation, travel costs, visa application or residence permit. living expenses, personal computers, mobility, student union and local social security and other study-related costs are NOT included as scholarship holders can cover these expenses with this comprehensive scholarship.
          </p>
          <p>
           Presence at the respective hosting university is required without exception.
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->

        <article class="post-113 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-113">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Program Fees Self-funded students
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           We welcome applications from those who are able to self-fund our PROMISE programme fees and costs.
          </p>
          <p>
           Please make a responsible assessment of your financial situation before applying and also look for alternative sources of support, such as foundation grants, employer support, or state scholarships.
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Programme country students
          </h2>
          <p>
           These are students who hold a passport from one of the European Union or EEA countries. They pay a tuition fee of
           <strong>
            €6,500
           </strong>
           for the entire programme (2 years).
          </p>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Partner country students
          </h2>
          <p>
           These are students who do not hold a passport from one of the European Union or EEA countries. They pay a tuition fee of
           <strong>
            €13,000
           </strong>
           for the entire programme  (2 years).
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            NOTE:
           </strong>
           In both cases, the tuition fee covers registration costs at each of the consortium partners, university administration and diploma costs, excursions, lab costs and participation in summer schools.
          </p>
          <p>
           Required literature, accommodation, travel costs, visa, and residence permit. living expenses, personal computers, student union and local social security, and other study-related costs are NOT included in the above-mentioned tuition fee.
          </p>
          <p>
           The tuition fee will be paid in two installments to the consortium coordinator (UOULU).
          </p>
          <p>
           All students receive comprehensive insurance (with the Eramus+ requirements) from the PROMISE consortium.
          </p>
          <p>
           Students must meet the financing requirements for residence permit application, including:
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            You must have 6,720 euros in your bank account when you submit the application.
           </li>
           <li>
            You must have 560 euros per month at your disposal.
           </li>
          </ul>

           Suggestions for other funds to finance your studies
          </h2>

            </a>
            – funded by the European, Audiovisual and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA) of the European Union

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-117 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-117">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Erasmus Scholarship
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Three types of scholarships are available for non-EU and EU students alike.
          </p>
          <p>
           1) A total of
           <strong>
            21 Erasmus Mundus
           </strong>
           full scholarships are available each year for four intakes from 2022 to 2025. In 2022, EMJM PROMISE awarded scholarships to students from:
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Partner Countries: 7 scholarships
           </li>
           <li>
            Specifically targeted regions: 6 scholarships
           </li>
           <li>
            Programme countries: 8 scholarships
           </li>
           <li>
            Also, a partial scholarship is to host students with special needs
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           The Erasmus Mundus scholarship has a value of EUR 1400 per month as a living allowance, for a total duration of 24 months. The scholarship will be a contribution to the costs incurred by the beneficiary students. In addition, the tuition fees for scholarship holders are waived.
          </p>
          <p>
           The scholarship is
           <strong>
            bound to the presence
           </strong>
           at the partner universities. Late arrivals will lead to a pro-rate reduction. Payment of the scholarships will be at the end of the month and requires that all residence formalities have been completed. Therefore, even scholarship holders need to have
           <strong>
            sufficient funds
           </strong>
           for travelling to Finland, getting accommodation in Oulu and covering their living costs for at least one month!
          </p>
          <p>
           2)
           <strong>
            Six full scholarships
           </strong>
           are for IPA countries (tuition fees and living allowance)
          </p>
          <p>
           3)
           <strong>
            Five additional Tuition Fee scholarships
           </strong>
           will be available from the Consortium of Universities EMJM PROMISE (doesn’t include living allowance).
          </p>
          <p>
           All students receive comprehensive insurance (with the Eramus+ requirements) from the PROMISE consortium.
          </p>
          <p>
           EMJM PROMISE scholarships are offered to students from all over the world based on excellence. However, the consortium needs to ensure geographical balance – i.e. no more than 10% of the total number of scholarships awarded during the project implementation should be awarded to candidates from the same nationality (this rule does not apply to top-up scholarships from
           <strong>
            targeted regions
           </strong>
           of the world, if applicable).
          </p>
          <p>
           Students who have previously obtained an EMJM scholarship are not eligible to apply for an additional scholarship under the EMJM PROMISE.
          </p>
          <h4 class="wp-block-heading">
           Candidate / Student Declaration
          </h4>
          <p>
           To avoid double-funding of students, the EMJMD consortium requests the students to declare (both at the application stage and in the student agreement) the following:
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            “The student candidate/scholarship holder declares to not have already benefited from a previous EMJMD scholarship or an Erasmus Mundus Master Course/Joint Doctorate scholarship.
           </li>
           <li>
            The student candidate/scholarship holder commits to not benefit from another EU funded scholarship scheme to follow the same EMJMD course for the entire period of the course.
           </li>
           <li>
            The financial support shall be repaid by the scholarship holder in case of fraud or false declaration.”
           </li>
          </ul>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

        <article class="post-248 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-248">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Students & Alumni
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           The Erasmus Mundus Association is the platform for prospective and current students and for the alumni of the Erasmus Mundus programs. They offer additional information and help from the students’ point of view and it is a great place to share EM experiences.
          </p>
          <p>
           PROMISE students are encouraged to join the Erasmus Students and Alumni Association and participate in its activities. Learn more about
           <a data-id="https://www.em-a.eu/" data-type="URL" href="https://www.em-a.eu/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
            Erasmus Mundus Association
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-full">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-797" decoding="async" height="90" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/Erasmus-Association.jpg" width="205"/>
          </figure>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

        <article class="post-333 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-333">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Student Rights and Obligations
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Once the student applications have been accepted by the PROMISE Consortium Committee, the Consortium Universities enrol these students according to their regulations where each student will follow at least one semester of the PROMISE master.
           </li>
           <li>
            Enrolment is only official after accepting the place. However, initially, registration takes place administratively at the coordinator’s institution.
           </li>
           <li>
            Upon registration, all students must sign a Student Agreement (link below), the content of which is defined by the Consortium Committee, defining their rights and duties.
           </li>
           <li>
            All PROMISE Students are obliged to:
           </li>
           <li>
            attend assiduously the prescribed lectures and examinations of the PROMISE program during the 1.5 academic years with the objective of successfully validating the modules and 0.5 for creating the thesis inherent in the program of studies.
           </li>
           <li>
            participate in joint activities, such as workshops, challenge weeks and summer schools even if there are no direct ECTS corresponding to it;
           </li>
           <li>
            attend assiduously the national language course offered in the host institutions even if there is no ECTS corresponding to it;
           </li>
           <li>
            to respect the internal rules and charts of the hosting institutions (library, computer chart, etc.);
           </li>
           <li>
            students must ensure that they do not engage in any form of unfair practice, whereby they take action which may result in them obtaining for themselves or others, an unpermitted advantage. An unfair practice is any act whereby a person may get an unpermitted advantage for him/herself or another.
           </li>
           <li>
            Participate in the PROMISE Master Programme course evaluation and quality assurance procedures
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Student Agreement Template
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           The program rules and commitment of students and consortium are stated in the Student Agreement see links below.
          </p>
          <p>
           For late arrival students (or early leaving), there is an indication of the prorates considering the date of their arrival to the program.
          </p>
          <p>
           2022
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/2022_Student-Agrement_EMJM-PROMISE-No-scholarship-st.pdf" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
            Student agreement for no-scholarships holders
           </a>
          </p>
          <p>
           2022
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/2022_Student-Agrement_EMJM-PROMISE.pdf" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
            Student agreement for scholarship holders
           </a>
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="https://unioulu-my.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/personal/msincheg_univ_yo_oulu_fi/Documents/2022-2027%20EMJM%20PROMISSE/21.%20Students%20agreement/signed%20-%203rd%20intake/240513%20-%20Student_agreement_with%20Scholarship_3rd%20intake.pdf?csf=1&web=1&e=aGsTRP">
            2024 Student agreement full scholarship
           </a>
           holders
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-353 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-353">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Practicalities for admitted students
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           University of Oulu – Finland (UOULU)
          </h2>
          <p>
           In order to get a student right and apply for a student visa, accepted students with or without scholarships should apply to the official call in studyinfo.fi from 3rd to 16th April 2023.
          </p>
          <p>
           Admitted students must follow the regular procedure of the university. Familiarize yourself with the application and relevant information
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="https://www.oulu.fi/en/apply/applying-non-finnish-qualification">
            https://www.oulu.fi/en/apply/applying-non-finnish-qualification
           </a>
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="https://www.oulu.fi/en/for-students">
            https://www.oulu.fi/en/for-students
           </a>
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            All students must register as a present for the Autumn Semester. it can be done at faculty study Affairs or online or by filling out the form at
            <a href="https://www.oulu.fi/external/enrolment_and_registration.pdf">
             <strong>
              https://www.oulu.fi/external/enrolment_and_registration.pdf
             </strong>
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Students must be registered for the four semesters in UOulu (pay union and student healthcare fees)
           </li>
          </ul>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Student union fee payment: https://www.oyy.fi/for-students/membership/?lang=en
           </li>
          </ul>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Student healthcare fee: https://www.kela.fi/web/en/healthcare-fee-for-students-in-higher-education
           </li>
          </ul>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Things to do before arriving https://www.oulu.fi/en/for-students/new-students-welcome-university-oulu/new-degree-students
           </li>
           <li>
            Hosing (links for alternatives to find accommodation in Oulu): https://www.oulu.fi/en/for-students/student-wellbeing-and-everyday-life/housing-oulu
           </li>
          </ul>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Montanuniversität Leoben – Austria (MUL)
          </h2>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            In order to obtain the diploma from MUL, you have to be registered here all four semesters. Registration at MUL will be online, no physical presentation of your documents is required. You will be contacted by email.
           </li>
           <li>
            You need to pay the students’ union membership fee (approx. 20 € per semester) every semester – also when doing a module away from Leoben.
           </li>
           <li>
            The student visa you needed to come to Finland covers your time in Austria as well.
           </li>
          </ul>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           University of Zagreb – Croatia (UNIZG)
          </h2>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Housing (links to accommodation options at every University)
            <br/>
            <a href="http://www.unizg.hr/homepage/international-exchange/exchange-students/student-services/housing/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             http://www.unizg.hr/homepage/international-exchange/exchange-students/student-services/housing/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Insurance (basic information on insurance – link to guidelines for insurance of Mundus joint master students eacea.ec.europa.eu)
           </li>
           <li>
            Special Needs (links to Office for students with disabilities at every university)
            <br/>
            <a href="http://www.unizg.hr/homepage/international-exchange/exchange-students/student-services/office-for-students-with-disabilities/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             http://www.unizg.hr/homepage/international-exchange/exchange-students/student-services/office-for-students-with-disabilities/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Visas (links to information on visa at every country)
            <br/>
            <a href="http://www.mvep.hr/en/consular-information/visas/visa-requirements-overview/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             http://www.mvep.hr/en/consular-information/visas/visa-requirements-overview/
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
           Universidad Federico Santa Maria – Chile (USM)
          </h2>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Housing links: USM does not offer university accommodation, but on this page you will find information to find where to stay during your stay:
            <br/>
            <a href="https://oai.usm.cl/en/international-students/exchange-at-the-usm/accommodation/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             https://oai.usm.cl/en/international-students/exchange-at-the-usm/accommodation/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Visas: Foreign students can apply for student visa given by the Chilean Ministry of External Affairs.
            <br/>
            <a href="https://minrel.gob.cl/obtainment-of-a-student-resident-visa-for-foreign-born-citizens/minrel_old/2014-10-08/115520.html" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             https://minrel.gob.cl/obtainment-of-a-student-resident-visa-for-foreign-born-citizens/minrel_old/2014-10-08/115520.html
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Special needs: USM has a Gender Equity and Inclusiveness Unit.
            <br/>
            <a href="https://vinculacion.usm.cl/equidad-de-genero-e-inclusion/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
             https://vinculacion.usm.cl/equidad-de-genero-e-inclusion/
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-1040 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1040">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           News & Calendar
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <ul class="wp-block-latest-posts__list has-dates wp-block-latest-posts">
           <li>
            <a class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-title" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/4th-intake-evaluation-of-applications-complete/">
             4th intake: Evaluation of applications complete
            </a>
            <time class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-date" datetime="2025-03-17T09:10:20+02:00">
             March 17, 2025
            </time>
            <div class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-excerpt">
             All formally compliant applications to our 4th intake have now been evaluated. The consortium is finalizing its selections. Notifications to all applicants will go out shortly via email. Stay tuned!
            </div>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-title" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/update-evaluation-for-the-4th-intake/">
             Update: Evaluation for the 4th intake
            </a>
            <time class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-date" datetime="2025-03-04T09:05:36+02:00">
             March 4, 2025
            </time>
            <div class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-excerpt">
             Of the roughly 800 sent applications, about 270 made it into the assessment stage. Evaluation is still going on. The selection by the PROMISE board and the respective notifications are now expected for 15 March (was: beginning of March). Stay
             <a class="read-more" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/update-evaluation-for-the-4th-intake/">
              Read More …
             </a>
            </div>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-title" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/leoben-the-next-destination-for-our-erasmus-promise-program/">
             Leoben: The Next Destination for Our Erasmus PROMISE Program
            </a>
            <time class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-date" datetime="2025-02-18T10:01:00+02:00">
             February 18, 2025
            </time>
            <div class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-excerpt">
             This February, our third cohort embarks on an exciting new chapter at Montanuniversität Leoben, where they will complete Module 2 of the Erasmus PROMISE program. This module will focus on industrial mineral processing and bulk solid technology, equipping students with
             <a class="read-more" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/leoben-the-next-destination-for-our-erasmus-promise-program/">
              Read More …
             </a>
            </div>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-title" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-our-chilean-partners/">
             Visiting our Chilean Partners!!!
            </a>
            <time class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-date" datetime="2025-02-04T10:50:05+02:00">
             February 4, 2025
            </time>
            <div class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-excerpt">
             Our second cohort of students had the extraordinary opportunity to visit some of our esteemed partners in the stunning mining regions of Antofagasta and Calama, Chile. This unforgettable experience gave them invaluable insights into cutting-edge mining and water management processes
             <a class="read-more" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-our-chilean-partners/">
              Read More …
             </a>
            </div>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-title" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/evaluation-of-the-applications-to-the-4th-intake-in-progress/">
             Evaluation of the applications to the 4th intake in progress
            </a>
            <time class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-date" datetime="2025-01-29T14:14:11+02:00">
             January 29, 2025
            </time>
            <div class="wp-block-latest-posts__post-excerpt">
             About 800 (!) applications have been submitted in the recent call for scholarships with the 4th intake. They are currently being checked for completeness. The valid applications will then be assessed and ranked. The PROMISE academic board expects to have
             <a class="read-more" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/evaluation-of-the-applications-to-the-4th-intake-in-progress/">
              Read More …
             </a>
            </div>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-141 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-141">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Contact Us
          </h1>
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Before sending inquieries about your application and eligibility, please
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/faq/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
            check the FAQ
           </a>
           – most likely you will find your answer there already!
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="mailto:info@master-promise.eu">
            info@master-promise.eu
           </a>
          </p>
          <div aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer" style="height:40px">
          </div>
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-1 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <h3 class="wp-block-heading">
             <strong>
              University of Oulu
             </strong>
            </h3>
            <p>
             Campus Linnanmaa
            </p>
            <p>
             Pentti Kaiteran katu 1, 90570
            </p>
            <p>
             Oulu, Finland
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <h3 class="wp-block-heading">
             <strong>
              Montanuniversität Leoben
             </strong>
            </h3>
            <p>
             Chair of Mineral Processing
            </p>
            <p>
             Franz Josef-Straße 18
            </p>
            <p>
             8700 Leoben, Austria
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-2 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <h3 class="wp-block-heading">
             <strong>
              University of Zagreb
             </strong>
            </h3>
            <p>
             Trg Republike Hrvatske 14
            </p>
            <p>
             10000 Zagreb, Croatia
            </p>
            <p>
             Faculty of Mining, Geology and Petroleum Engineering
            </p>
            <p>
             Pierottijeva 6 10000 Zagreb, Croatia
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow">
            <h3 class="wp-block-heading">
             <strong>
              Universidad Técnica Federico Santa María
             </strong>
            </h3>
            <p>
             Avenida España 1680
            </p>
            <p>
             Valparaíso, Chile
            </p>
           </div>

         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           4th intake: Evaluation of applications complete
          </h1>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/4th-intake-evaluation-of-applications-complete/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2025-03-17T09:10:20+02:00">
              March 17, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/coordinator1/">
              EMJM PROMISE Programme office - MUL
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           All formally compliant applications to our 4th intake have now been evaluated. The consortium is finalizing its selections. Notifications to all applicants will go out shortly via email. Stay tuned!
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
          <span class="cat-links">

        <article class="post-1400 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-1400">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Update: Evaluation for the 4th intake
          </h1>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/update-evaluation-for-the-4th-intake/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-03-04T09:05:36+02:00">
              March 4, 2025
             </time>
             <time class="updated" datetime="2025-03-04T09:05:37+02:00">
              March 4, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/coordinator1/">
              EMJM PROMISE Programme office - MUL
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Of the roughly 800 sent applications, about 270 made it into the assessment stage. Evaluation is still going on.
          </p>
          <p>
           The selection by the PROMISE board and the respective notifications are now expected for 15 March (was: beginning of March). Stay tuned!
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
          <span class="cat-links">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/category/news/" rel="category tag">
            News
           </a>
          </span>
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

        <article class="post-1389 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general category-news" id="post-1389">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Leoben: The Next Destination for Our Erasmus PROMISE Program
          </h1>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/leoben-the-next-destination-for-our-erasmus-promise-program/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-02-18T10:01:00+02:00">
              February 18, 2025
             </time>
             <time class="updated" datetime="2025-03-07T12:38:34+02:00">
              March 7, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/projectadmuoulu/">
              Diego Poblete
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
           This February, our third cohort embarks on an exciting new chapter at Montanuniversität Leoben, where they will complete Module 2 of the Erasmus PROMISE program. This module will focus on industrial mineral processing and bulk solid technology, equipping students with cutting-edge knowledge and hands-on experience in these critical fields.
          </p>
          <p>
           Why Montanuniversität Leoben?
          </p>
          <p>
           Montanuniversität Leoben is renowned for its science, research, and education excellence. As one of Austria’s leading technical universities, it offers a world-class learning environment for future mining, metallurgy, and materials science experts.
          </p>
          <p>
           A Legacy of Innovation
          </p>
          <p>
           Founded on November 4, 1840, the university began as the Steiermärkisch-Ständische Montanlehranstalt in Austria’s historic mining region. In 1849, Peter Tunner relocated the institution to Leoben, which has since grown into a hub for scientific advancement.
          </p>
          <p>
           Today, Montanuniversität Leoben is a proud member of TU Austria, a prestigious alliance of Austria’s top technical universities. It continues its legacy of pioneering research and industry-driven education.
          </p>
          <p>
           As our students step into this new phase of the PROMISE program, they will be immersed in an innovative academic environment, learning from leading experts and engaging in hands-on projects that will shape the industry’s future.
          </p>
          <p>
           Stay tuned for updates on their journey!
          </p>
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-1403" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="768" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/WhatsApp-Image-2025-03-05-at-15.51.05-1024x768.jpeg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/WhatsApp-Image-2025-03-05-at-15.51.05-1024x768.jpeg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/WhatsApp-Image-2025-03-05-at-15.51.05-300x225.jpeg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/WhatsApp-Image-2025-03-05-at-15.51.05-768x576.jpeg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/WhatsApp-Image-2025-03-05-at-15.51.05-1536x1152.jpeg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/WhatsApp-Image-2025-03-05-at-15.51.05-2048x1536.jpeg 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/WhatsApp-Image-2025-03-05-at-15.51.05-360x270.jpeg 360w" width="1024"/>
          </figure>
         </div>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="inner-wrapper">
      <div class="content-area" id="primary">
       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-1337 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-1337">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Visiting our Chilean Partners!!!
          </h1>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-our-chilean-partners/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-02-04T10:50:05+02:00">
              February 4, 2025
             </time>
             <time class="updated" datetime="2025-01-23T10:51:31+02:00">
              January 23, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/projectadmuoulu/">
              Diego Poblete
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Our second cohort of students had the extraordinary opportunity to visit some of our esteemed partners in the stunning mining regions of Antofagasta and Calama, Chile. This unforgettable experience gave them invaluable insights into cutting-edge mining and water management processes and a deeper appreciation for the industry’s pivotal role in the region.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Discovering the World’s Largest Open-Pit Mine
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           One of the highlights of the visit was a tour of
           <strong>
            Chuquicamata
           </strong>
           , the world’s largest open-pit copper mine, operated by the state-owned mining giant
           <strong>
            Codelco
           </strong>
           . This iconic site showcases Chile’s mining industry’s immense scale and significance. Our students also explored the
           <strong>
            Ministro Hales Division
           </strong>
           , where they learned about its groundbreaking and unique process for extracting copper from oxides—a testament to the innovation driving modern mining.
          </p>
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-1338" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="768" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-2-1024x768.jpeg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-2-1024x768.jpeg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-2-300x225.jpeg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-2-768x576.jpeg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-2-1536x1152.jpeg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-2-360x270.jpeg 360w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-2.jpeg 1600w" width="1024"/>
          </figure>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Innovative Solutions at Ecometales
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           The journey continued with a visit to the
           <strong>
            Ecometales plant
           </strong>
           , a pioneer in sustainable mining practices. Here, students were introduced to their patented process for arsenic abatement in mining sludges. This innovative technology underscores the industry’s commitment to reducing environmental impacts and advancing cleaner production methods.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Exploring Antofagasta Minerals’ Centinela Plant
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Another remarkable stop was at the
           <strong>
            Centinela plant
           </strong>
           , part of the
           <strong>
            Antofagasta Minerals
           </strong>
           portfolio. The students witnessed firsthand how the plant prepares for its most significant expansion, extending its operational life by over 30 years. With a projected annual production of 144,000 tons of copper, this expansion represents an essential milestone in the company’s history.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Academic Excellence at Universidad Católica del Norte
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           The final leg of the visit brought the students to our partner institution,
           <strong>
            Universidad Católica del Norte
           </strong>
           (UCN) in Antofagasta. They explored the university’s
           <strong>
            Geological Museum
           </strong>
           , gaining insights into the region’s rich geological heritage. At the
           <strong>
            CEITZASA center
           </strong>
           , they delved into advanced research on seawater desalination and water reuse—innovations crucial for sustainable development in the arid desert environment.
          </p>
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-1339" decoding="async" height="461" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1024x461.jpeg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1024x461.jpeg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-300x135.jpeg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-768x346.jpeg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1536x691.jpeg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-360x162.jpeg 360w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57.jpeg 1600w" width="1024"/>
          </figure>
          <p>
           <strong>
            A Transformative Learning Experience
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           This enriching journey allowed our students to engage with world-class mining operations, cutting-edge technologies, and academic excellence. It deepened their understanding of the industry and inspired them to pursue innovative solutions for the future. The experience highlighted Chile’s role as a global mining and water management leader, leaving an indelible mark on all participants.
          </p>
          <p>
           Understanding of the industry, and it has inspired them to pursue innovative solutions for the future. The experience highlighted Chile’s role as a global mining and water management leader, leaving an indelible mark on all participants.
          </p>
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-1340" decoding="async" height="461" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1-1024x461.jpeg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1-1024x461.jpeg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1-300x135.jpeg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1-768x346.jpeg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1-1536x691.jpeg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1-360x162.jpeg 360w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-02-at-16.41.57-1.jpeg 1600w" width="1024"/>
          </figure>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->

          </span>
         </footer>

        </article>

        <article class="post-1371 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-1371">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Evaluation of the applications to the 4th intake in progress
          </h1>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/evaluation-of-the-applications-to-the-4th-intake-in-progress/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-01-29T14:14:11+02:00">
              January 29, 2025
             </time>
             <time class="updated" datetime="2025-01-29T14:14:12+02:00">
              January 29, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/coordinator1/">
              EMJM PROMISE Programme office - MUL
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           About 800 (!) applications have been submitted in the recent call for scholarships with the 4th intake. They are currently being checked for completeness. The valid applications will then be assessed and ranked.
          </p>
          <p>
           The PROMISE academic board expects to have their selection for the next cohort prepared by the beginning of March.
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
          <span class="cat-links">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/category/news/" rel="category tag">
            News
           </a>
          </span>
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

       <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
        <article class="post-1328 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general category-news" id="post-1328">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h1 class="entry-title">
           Visiting Kemi Mine and Tornio Processing Plant
          </h1>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-kemi-mine-and-tornio-processing-plant/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-01-21T12:32:59+02:00">
              January 21, 2025
             </time>
             <time class="updated" datetime="2025-01-21T12:33:30+02:00">
              January 21, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/projectadmuoulu/">
              Diego Poblete
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Last week in Oulu, our third cohort had the privilege of visiting the underground Kemi Mine and the stainless steel and ferrochrome processing plant in Tornio, both owned by Outokumpu.
          </p>
          <p>
           At Outokumpu’s Kemi Mine, all operations are conducted underground. This mine is the primary source of chromite ore, processed into upgraded lumpy ore and fine concentrate through advanced industrial methods on the surface. These materials are then transported to the ferrochrome smelter in Tornio, co-located with Outokumpu’s integrated stainless steel mill.
          </p>
          <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-1329" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="768" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2025-01-20-at-15.54.40-1024x768.jpeg" srcset="https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2025-01-20-at-15.54.40-1024x768.jpeg 1024w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2025-01-20-at-15.54.40-300x225.jpeg 300w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2025-01-20-at-15.54.40-768x576.jpeg 768w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2025-01-20-at-15.54.40-1536x1152.jpeg 1536w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2025-01-20-at-15.54.40-2048x1536.jpeg 2048w, https://www.master-promise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WhatsApp-Image-2025-01-20-at-15.54.40-360x270.jpeg 360w" width="1024"/>
          </figure>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Sustainability at the Core
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Sustainability is a cornerstone of Outokumpu’s operations. The environmental impact of the Kemi Mine is minimal due to its gravity-based beneficiation process, which eliminates the need for chemicals. Additionally, the carbon footprint of Outokumpu’s ferrochrome is 67% lower than the industry average, contributing to the lowest carbon footprint for stainless steel on the market.
          </p>
          <p>
           The Kemi Mine is on track to achieve carbon neutrality by 2025. Key initiatives include:
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Utilizing carbon-free electricity.
           </li>
           <li>
            Adopting biofuels for transportation and machinery.
           </li>
           <li>
            Replacing natural gas and propane with biogas for heating.
           </li>
           <li>
            Electrifying mining machinery to reduce fuel dependency.
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           As a significant milestone, the mine has transitioned to renewable biofuels, achieving 30% of its carbon neutrality goal.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            The Integrated Tornio Operations
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Outokumpu’s Tornio operations represent the company’s largest integrated facility and the world’s only fully integrated stainless steel plant. This site includes:
          </p>
          <ul class="wp-block-list">
           <li>
            Two stainless steel melt shop lines.
           </li>
           <li>
            A hot rolling mill.
           </li>
           <li>
            A cold rolling plant.
           </li>
           <li>
            Lines for brushing, polishing, slitting, and cut-to-length processing.
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           The Tornio facility is further enhanced by the adjacent Röyttä Harbor (operated by Outokumpu Shipping Oy), facilitating seamless transportation of stainless steel coils to customers and to a finishing line in Terneuzen, Netherlands. Tornio is also home to one of Outokumpu’s three R&D centers, underscoring its leadership in innovation.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Commitment to Environmental Stewardship
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Outokumpu’s Tornio operations are a testament to the company’s dedication to sustainability. Despite increasing production levels, water quality in the surrounding areas remains high, and rare bird species thrive in a nearby conservation zone. Stainless steel production at Tornio began in 1976 with an initial capacity of 50,000 tonnes per annum (tpa). A major expansion project completed in 2004 increased the facility’s capacity to 1.2 million tpa.
          </p>
          <p>
           The Kemi Mine and Tornio processing plants illustrate Outokumpu’s commitment to innovation, sustainability, and excellence in stainless steel production.
          </p>
         </div>

          <span>

          </span>
         </h1>
        </header>
        <!-- .page-header -->
        <article class="post-1396 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-1396">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h2 class="entry-title">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/4th-intake-evaluation-of-applications-complete/" rel="bookmark">
            4th intake: Evaluation of applications complete
           </a>
          </h2>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/4th-intake-evaluation-of-applications-complete/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2025-03-17T09:10:20+02:00">
              March 17, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/coordinator1/">
              EMJM PROMISE Programme office - MUL
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           All formally compliant applications to our 4th intake have now been evaluated. The consortium is finalizing its selections. Notifications to all applicants will go out shortly via email. Stay tuned!
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
          <span class="cat-links">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/category/news/" rel="category tag">
            News
           </a>
          </span>
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>
        <!-- #post-## -->
        <article class="post-1400 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-1400">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h2 class="entry-title">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/update-evaluation-for-the-4th-intake/" rel="bookmark">
            Update: Evaluation for the 4th intake
           </a>
          </h2>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/update-evaluation-for-the-4th-intake/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-03-04T09:05:36+02:00">
              March 4, 2025
             </time>
             <time class="updated" datetime="2025-03-04T09:05:37+02:00">
              March 4, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/coordinator1/">
              EMJM PROMISE Programme office - MUL
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Of the roughly 800 sent applications, about 270 made it into the assessment stage. Evaluation is still going on. The selection by the PROMISE board and the respective notifications are now expected for 15 March (was: beginning of March). Stay
           <a class="read-more" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/update-evaluation-for-the-4th-intake/">
            Read More …
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
          <span class="cat-links">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/category/news/" rel="category tag">
            News
           </a>
          </span>
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>

        <article class="post-1389 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general category-news" id="post-1389">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h2 class="entry-title">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/leoben-the-next-destination-for-our-erasmus-promise-program/" rel="bookmark">
            Leoben: The Next Destination for Our Erasmus PROMISE Program
           </a>
          </h2>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/leoben-the-next-destination-for-our-erasmus-promise-program/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-02-18T10:01:00+02:00">

             </time>

              March 7, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/projectadmuoulu/">
              Diego Poblete
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           This February, our third cohort embarks on an exciting new chapter at Montanuniversität Leoben, where they will complete Module 2 of the Erasmus PROMISE program. This module will focus on industrial mineral processing and bulk solid technology, equipping students with
           <a class="read-more" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/leoben-the-next-destination-for-our-erasmus-promise-program/">
            Read More …
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">

            General
           </a>
           ,
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/category/news/" rel="category tag">
            News
           </a>
          </span>
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>
        <!-- #post-## -->
        <article class="post-1337 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-1337">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h2 class="entry-title">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-our-chilean-partners/" rel="bookmark">
            Visiting our Chilean Partners!!!
           </a>
          </h2>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-our-chilean-partners/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-02-04T10:50:05+02:00">

             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Our second cohort of students had the extraordinary opportunity to visit some of our esteemed partners in the stunning mining regions of Antofagasta and Calama, Chile. This unforgettable experience gave them invaluable insights into cutting-edge mining and water management processes
           <a class="read-more" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-our-chilean-partners/">

        <header class="page-header">
         <h1 class="page-title">
          Month:
          <span>
           January 2025
          </span>
         </h1>
        </header>
        <!-- .page-header -->
        <article class="post-1371 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-1371">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h2 class="entry-title">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/evaluation-of-the-applications-to-the-4th-intake-in-progress/" rel="bookmark">
            Evaluation of the applications to the 4th intake in progress
           </a>
          </h2>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/evaluation-of-the-applications-to-the-4th-intake-in-progress/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-01-29T14:14:11+02:00">
              January 29, 2025
             </time>
             <time class="updated" datetime="2025-01-29T14:14:12+02:00">
              January 29, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/coordinator1/">
              EMJM PROMISE Programme office - MUL
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           About 800 (!) applications have been submitted in the recent call for scholarships with the 4th intake. They are currently being checked for completeness. The valid applications will then be assessed and ranked. The PROMISE academic board expects to have
           <a class="read-more" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/evaluation-of-the-applications-to-the-4th-intake-in-progress/">
            Read More …
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
          <span class="cat-links">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/category/news/" rel="category tag">
            News
           </a>
          </span>
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>
        <!-- #post-## -->
        <article class="post-1328 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general category-news" id="post-1328">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h2 class="entry-title">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-kemi-mine-and-tornio-processing-plant/" rel="bookmark">
            Visiting Kemi Mine and Tornio Processing Plant
           </a>
          </h2>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-kemi-mine-and-tornio-processing-plant/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published" datetime="2025-01-21T12:32:59+02:00">
              January 21, 2025
             </time>
             <time class="updated" datetime="2025-01-21T12:33:30+02:00">
              January 21, 2025
             </time>
            </a>
           </span>
           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/projectadmuoulu/">
              Diego Poblete
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Last week in Oulu, our third cohort had the privilege of visiting the underground Kemi Mine and the stainless steel and ferrochrome processing plant in Tornio, both owned by Outokumpu. At Outokumpu’s Kemi Mine, all operations are conducted underground. This
           <a class="read-more" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/visiting-kemi-mine-and-tornio-processing-plant/">
            Read More …
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- .entry-content -->
         <footer class="entry-footer">
          <span class="cat-links">
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/category/general/" rel="category tag">
            General
           </a>
           ,
           <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/category/news/" rel="category tag">
            News
           </a>
          </span>
         </footer>
         <!-- .entry-footer -->
        </article>
        <!-- #post-## -->

            Transforming Futures: A Circular Economy Journey in Croatia 🌍
           </a>
          </h2>
          <div class="entry-meta">
           <span class="posted-on">
            <a href="https://www.master-promise.eu/news/transforming-futures-a-circular-economy-journey-in-croatia-%f0%9f%8c%8d/" rel="bookmark">
             <time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2024-12-03T09:47:27+02:00">

            </a>

           <span class="byline">
            <span class="author vcard">

         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>
           Imagine standing at the crossroads of innovation and sustainability—this is exactly where half of our second intake finds themselves today, forging their career paths in Zagreb, Croatia. Immersed in cutting-edge courses like Urban Mining and Circular Economy and Tailings Management

        <article class="post-1277 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-1277">

          <!-- .entry-meta -->
         </header>
         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>

        <article class="post-1274 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news" id="post-1274">

           </a>
          </h2>
          <div class="entry-meta">

            <span class="author vcard">
             <a class="url fn n" href="https://www.master-promise.eu/author/coordinator1/">

            </span>
           </span>

          <!-- .entry-meta -->

         <!-- .entry-header -->
         <div class="entry-content">
          <p>

          </p>

           </a>
